definition: to wash/to clean out/to cleanse/to eliminate/to dredge
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Milan will meet Manchester United for the first knock-out round of the Champions League.
sentences.chinese: 米蘭將會在冠軍聯賽第一輪淘汰賽遭遇曼徹斯特聯隊。

sentences.english: This season, the Second Group Phase has been abolished in favor of a two-legged knockout round .
sentences.chinese: 本賽季，原先的第二階段小組賽改爲兩回合的淘汰賽。

sentences.english: The Competition was a three-round elimination match.
sentences.chinese: 比賽以三回合的淘汰賽形式進行。

sentences.english: Is due to the knock-out competition starting on both sides fight to the bitter end.
sentences.chinese: 由於是淘汰賽，比賽開始，雙方就拼個你死我活。

sentences.english: 'knock-out' element of each top competition is fantastic.
sentences.chinese: 每項賽事中的淘汰賽總是很讓人着迷。

sentences.english: Many matches in the knockout stages also have been decided in shootouts.
sentences.chinese: 許多淘汰賽階段比賽也由點球決定。

sentences.english: In knockouts, decisions are crucial and misses are also crucial .
sentences.chinese: 在淘汰賽中，判決是至關緊要的，失誤也同樣如此。

definition: competition schedule/the course of a race
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
